author: erwinwildenburg
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
Generate a DSC file from a .NET Core application.

Expected behavior
-----------------
The DSC code executes normally.

Actual behavior
---------------
It ends with the following error:
`Cannot find the type for custom attribute 'Microsoft.PowerShell.DesiredStateConfiguration.ArgumentToConfigurationDataTransformation'. Make sure that the assembly that contains this type is loaded.`

Environment data
----------------

```
PSVersion: {6.0.0-alpha}
PSCompatibleVersions: System.Version[7]
PSEdition: Core
BuildVersion: 3.0.0
CLRVersion: null
SerializationVersion: 1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion: 3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion: 2.3
GitCommitId: "Could not find file 'C:\\Users\\xxx\\.nuget\\packages\\system.management.automation\\6.0.0-alpha17\\lib\\netstandard1.6\\powershell.version'."

```

comments.author: erwinwildenburg
comments.body:
This is working with beta1.
Closing this.

title: Generate DSC from .NET not working, missing assembly?
